title: Guarding Coherence

panel_structure.description: The Architect gently pulling labeled petals from a flower. Each petal shows borrowed identity: 'Mother's fear,' 'Society's dream,' 'Grandfather's laugh.' Petals fall like snow. Evan watches with growing alarm.

Close-up of what remains: not emptiness but a glowing coherent centerâ€”a pattern of light that shows how all pieces were organized. The working model that made borrowed fragments into functional self.

transformation_notes: This completes the identity trilogy. From discovering borrowed pieces (122) through defending them (124) to revealing we guard not pieces but the coherence that organizes them into a working self (126).
dialogue_rhythm: From anxious protection through gentle deconstruction to transcendent revelation
narrator_role: Witness to the completion of identity understanding
